intro: Andromeda wilmingtonia, commonly known as the Wilmington azalea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreens that thrive in acidic soils. The plant features dense, evergreen foliage with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. Its flowers are typically pink or red, appearing in clusters during the spring. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
